exam.question: In previous times, when fresh meat was in short _______，  pigeons were kept by many households as a source of food.

answer.explain: in short supply： 稀少的， 缺乏的。句意： 以前， 在鲜肉供给不足时， 许多人家就养鸽子作为食物。store： 储存， 贮藏， 积蓄； provision： 准备， 供应； reserve： 储备(物)， 收藏， 保存。

sentences.sContent: The nation’s fuel supplies will not last forever.
sentences.sCn: 这个国家的燃料供应不会无穷无尽。

sentences.sContent: To protect the food supply , the government ordered the slaughter of affected cattle.
sentences.sCn: 为保护食品供应，政府下令宰杀被感染的牛。

sentences.sContent: ...surrounded by students who quickly supply the verbal answer while I am still processing the question...
...The water supply would stop; the streets might not be cleaned; schools would be closed...
...and means they can supply advice and connections as well as money...
...Having such a large supply of talented women teachers meant that society could pay less for their services...
...A constant supply of food should be given until the cold is over and spring has come...
...thus helping to expand the supply of a key sustainable material...

phrases.pCn: 供水系统；供应系统；包干制
做代课教师；做代理教师
供电系统；建筑供配电系统
开关电源；交换式电源供应
能源供应；电源；供能供电

words.tran: 供应厂商，供应国；供应者

trans.tranOther: an amount of something that is available to be used
